messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?
There's a guy that just tried to get out of his car.
He got out of his car and tried to what?
He got out of his car, and he tried to get in my truck.
What kind of car is he driving?
He's driving a red Jeep. His license plate number is YRF 481-2.
Which direction is he heading?
He's going west on Patton Avenue.
Where exactly on Patton Avenue?
At the light from New Leicester Highway.
And where are you now?
I'm on Patton, just passing Sevierville Road.
So he tried to get into your car, is that right?
Yeah, he tried to pull me out of the truck, and now he's right behind me.
Do you know why he tried to pull you out of the truck?
Because he cut me off, and I honked at him. When we got to the light, he jumped out and came to my truck.
What's your name?
Julie. Sorry, Julie Brown.
What's your phone number?
<phone number>
Can you describe the guy?
He's big, has a goatee, dark hair with gray in it.
Is he a white male?
Yes, he's a white male. There are three other people in the car with him.
What kind of vehicle are you in?
I'm in a silver Ford F-150 pick-up.
Are you sure it's a red Jeep Cherokee?
I'm not sure if it's a Cherokee, but it's a red Jeep. The license plate I gave is accurate.
Do you want to drive to a police station instead of home?
Yes, I don't want him following me home. Is there one nearby?
You can go to 970 Haywood Road, there's a substation there.
I'm almost to exit 44.
Are you still on Patton Avenue?
Yes, it's Patton Avenue. It just goes straight out. I didn't get on the freeway.
Okay, so head to 970 Haywood Road. It's where the library and fire station are.
There's a fire station in front of me. I'm heading there.
Okay, stay on the line with me. Can you pull over safely there?
He's still behind me. I'm scared to stop.
Try to get to a very public place like a restaurant or store with lots of people around.
Okay, I'll try to get to Shoney's or McDonald's after exit 44.
Stay on the line and let me know what happens.
He tried to whip around someone but got stuck in traffic.
Stay calm. Can you see what he's doing now?
He's stopping in the middle of the road. He's coming back.
Lock your doors. Stay in the car. Officers are on their way.
He's turned around and coming back.
Stay in your vehicle, keep the doors locked. What direction is he coming from now?
He drove past me but turned back. I think he's going away now.
Just stay there. We've got officers in route. Stay calm.
I can't see him now.
Okay, stay calm. Do you know this guy at all?
No, I don't know him.
Just hang tight. Officers are almost there. Can you flag them down when they arrive?
Yes, I will. Thank you.
Great, stay calm. They'll be there shortly.
Okay, I see the officer. Thank you.
Are you okay to hang up now?
Yes, thank you so much.
You're welcome. Stay safe.
